text: State Route 500 (SR 500) was a state highway located in Boulder City.Nevada Department of Transportation, State Maintained Highways, Descriptions, Index & Maps , January 2006 It ran for about along the original route of US 93 and historical US 466 on the Nevada Highway (former State Route 26) through the middle of town. It came into being when the US 93 designation was moved to a new "truck bypass" alignment along the upper reaches of Hemenway Wash in 1982. After being turned over to local control by NDOT, the street was renamed as Nevada Way by the city. ==References== 500
title: Nevada State Route 500
